methodsynopsis.sdesc: Quotes a string.
methodsynopsis.desc: An example is $db->qstr("Don't bother",magic_quotes_runtime());

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Usage: Store BLOBs and CLOBs
methodsynopsis.desc: Example: to store $var in a blob$conn->Execute('insert into TABLE (id,ablob) values(12,empty_blob())'); $conn->UpdateBlob('TABLE', 'ablob', $varHoldingBlob, 'ID=12', 'BLOB');$blobtype supports 'BLOB' and 'CLOB', but you need to change to 'empty_clob()'.to get length of LOB: select DBMS_LOB.GETLENGTH(ablob) from TABLEIf you are using CURSOR_SHARING = force, it appears this will case a segfault under oracle 8.1.7.0. Run: $db->Execute('ALTER SESSION SET CURSOR_SHARING=EXACT'); before UpdateBlob() then...

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Usage: store file pointed to by $var in a blob
Constructor
Quotes a string, without prefixing nor appending quotes.
Begin a Transaction. Must be followed by CommitTrans() or RollbackTrans().
Execute SQL, caching recordsets.
Flush cached recordsets that match a particular $sql statement.
methodsynopsis.desc: If $sql == false, then we purge all files in the cache.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Will select the supplied $page number from a recordset, given that it is paginated in pages of $nrows rows per page. It also saves two boolean values saying if the given page is the first and/or last one of the recordset. Added by Ivn Oliva to provide recordset pagination.
Will select, getting rows from $offset (1-based), for $nrows.
methodsynopsis.desc: This simulates the MySQL "select * from table limit $offset,$nrows" , and the PostgreSQL "select * from table limit $nrows offset $offset". Note that MySQL and PostgreSQL parameter ordering is the opposite of the other. eg. CacheSelectLimit(15,'select * from table',3); will return rows 1 to 3 (1-based) CacheSelectLimit(15,'select * from table',3,2); will return rows 3 to 5 (1-based)BUG: Currently CacheSelectLimit fails with $sql with LIMIT or TOP clause already set

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Close Connection
If database does not support transactions, always return true as data always commited
Different SQL databases used different methods to combine strings together.
methodsynopsis.desc: This function provides a wrapper.param s variable number of string parametersUsage: $db->Concat($str1,$str2);

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Connect to database
Converts a date "d" to a string that the database can understand.
Converts a timestamp "ts" to a string that the database can understand.
PEAR DB Compat - do not use internally
PEAR DB Compat - do not use internally.
Execute SQL
Generates a sequence id and stores it in $this->genID; GenID is only available if $this->hasGenID = true;
Generates an Insert Query based on an existing recordset.
methodsynopsis.desc: $arrFields is an associative array of fields with the value that should be assigned.Note: This function should only be used on a recordset that is run against a single table.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return first element of first row of sql statement. Recordset is disposed for you.
Return one row of sql statement. Recordset is disposed for you.
Generates an Update Query based on an existing recordset.
methodsynopsis.desc: $arrFields is an associative array of fields with the value that should be assigned.Note: This function should only be used on a recordset that is run against a single table and sql should only be a simple select stmt with no groupby/orderby/limit"Jonathan Younger" <jyounger@unilab.com>

methodsynopsis.sdesc: PEAR DB Compat - do not use internally
List columns names in a table as an array.
List columns in a database as an array of ADOFieldObjects.
methodsynopsis.desc: See top of file for definition of object.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: return the databases that the driver can connect to.
methodsynopsis.desc: Some databases will return an empty array.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: List indexes on a table as an array.
Always force a new connection to database - currently only works with oracle
PEAR DB Compat - do not use internally.
All error messages go through this bottleneck function.
methodsynopsis.desc: You can define your own handler by defining the function name in ADODB_OUTP.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Will select the supplied $page number from a recordset, given that it is paginated in pages of $nrows rows per page. It also saves two boolean values saying if the given page is the first and/or last one of the recordset. Added by Ivn Oliva to provide recordset pagination.
methodsynopsis.desc: See readme.htm#ex8 for an example of usage.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Establish persistent connect to database
Portable Insert ID. Pablo Roca
Should prepare the sql statement and return the stmt resource.
methodsynopsis.desc: For databases that do not support this, we return the $sql. To ensure compatibility with databases that do not support prepare:$stmt = $db->Prepare("insert into table (id, name) values (?,?)"); $db->Execute($stmt,array(1,'Jill')) or die('insert failed'); $db->Execute($stmt,array(2,'Joe')) or die('insert failed');

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Some databases, eg. mssql require a different function for preparing stored procedures. So we cannot use Prepare().
methodsynopsis.desc: Should prepare the stored procedure and return the stmt resource. For databases that do not support this, we return the $sql. To ensure compatibility with databases that do not support prepare:

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Correctly quotes a string so that all strings are escaped. We prefix and append to the string single-quotes.
methodsynopsis.desc: An example is $db->qstr("Don't bother",magic_quotes_runtime());

methodsynopsis.sdesc: PEAR DB Compat - do not use internally.
PEAR DB Compat
Insert or replace a single record. Note: this is not the same as MySQL's replace.
methodsynopsis.desc: ADOdb's Replace() uses update-insert semantics, not insert-delete-duplicates of MySQL. Also note that no table locking is done currently, so it is possible that the record be inserted twice by two programs...$this->Replace('products', array('prodname' =>"'Nails'","price" => 3.99), 'prodname');$table table name $fieldArray associative array of data (you must quote strings yourself). $keyCol the primary key field name or if compound key, array of field names autoQuote set to true to use a hueristic to quote strings. Works with nulls and numbers but does not work with dates nor SQL functions. has_autoinc the primary key is an auto-inc field, so skip in insert.Currently blob replace not supportedreturns 0 = fail, 1 = update, 2 = insert

methodsynopsis.sdesc: If database does not support transactions, rollbacks always fail, so return false
Lock a row, will escalate and lock the table if row locking not supported will normally free the lock at the end of the transaction
Choose a database to connect to. Many databases do not support this.
Will select, getting rows from $offset (1-based), for $nrows.
methodsynopsis.desc: This simulates the MySQL "select * from table limit $offset,$nrows" , and the PostgreSQL "select * from table limit $nrows offset $offset". Note that MySQL and PostgreSQL parameter ordering is the opposite of the other. eg. SelectLimit('select * from table',3); will return rows 1 to 3 (1-based) SelectLimit('select * from table',3,2); will return rows 3 to 5 (1-based)Uses SELECT TOP for Microsoft databases (when $this->hasTop is set) BUG: Currently SelectLimit fails with $sql with LIMIT or TOP clause already set

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Create serializable recordset. Breaks rs link to connection.
Change the SQL connection locale to a specified locale.
methodsynopsis.desc: This is used to get the date formats written depending on the client locale.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: PEAR DB Compat - do not use internally.
methodsynopsis.desc: The fetch modes for NUMERIC and ASSOC for PEAR DB and ADODB are identical for easy porting :-)

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Also in ADORecordSet.
Also in ADORecordSet.

Update a blob column, given a where clause. There are more sophisticated blob handling functions that we could have implemented, but all require a very complex API. Instead we have chosen something that is extremely simple to understand and use.
methodsynopsis.desc: Note: $blobtype supports 'BLOB' and 'CLOB', default is BLOB of course.Usage to update a $blobvalue which has a primary key blob_id=1 into a field blobtable.blobcolumn:UpdateBlob('blobtable', 'blobcolumn', $blobvalue, 'blob_id=1');Insert example:$conn->Execute('INSERT INTO blobtable (id, blobcol) VALUES (1, null)'); $conn->UpdateBlob('blobtable','blobcol',$blob,'id=1');

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Usage: UpdateBlob('TABLE', 'COLUMN', '/path/to/file', 'ID=1');
methodsynopsis.desc: $blobtype supports 'BLOB' and 'CLOB'$conn->Execute('INSERT INTO blobtable (id, blobcol) VALUES (1, null)'); $conn->UpdateBlob('blobtable','blobcol',$blobpath,'id=1');

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Usage: UpdateClob('TABLE', 'COLUMN', $var, 'ID=1', 'CLOB');
methodsynopsis.desc: $conn->Execute('INSERT INTO clobtable (id, clobcol) VALUES (1, null)'); $conn->UpdateClob('clobtable','clobcol',$clob,'id=1');

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Also in ADORecordSet.
methodsynopsis.desc: Format database date based on user defined format.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Private function to generate filename for caching.
methodsynopsis.desc: Filename is generated based on:sql statementdatabase type (oci8, ibase, ifx, etc)database nameuseridsetFetchMode (adodb 4.23) When not in safe mode, we create 256 sub-directories in the cache directory ($ADODB_CACHE_DIR). Assuming that we can have 50,000 files per directory with good performance, then we can scale to 12.8 million unique cached recordsets. Wow!

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Convert database recordset to an array recordset input recordset's cursor should be at beginning, and old $rs will be closed.
Constructor
set/returns the current recordset page when paginating
synonym for CurrentRow -- for ADO compat
set/returns the status of the atFirstPage flag when paginating
set/returns the status of the atLastPage flag when paginating
Clean up recordset
Get the ADOFieldObject of a specific column.
Fetch a row, returning PEAR_Error if no more rows.
methodsynopsis.desc: This is PEAR DB compat mode.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the fields array of the current row as an object for convenience.
methodsynopsis.desc: The default is lower-case field names.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the fields array of the current row as an object for convenience.
methodsynopsis.desc: The default is upper case field names.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the fields array of the current row as an object for convenience.
methodsynopsis.desc: The default case is lowercase field names.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Return the fields array of the current row as an object for convenience.
methodsynopsis.desc: The default case is uppercase.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Fetch a row, returning false if no more rows.
methodsynopsis.desc: This is PEAR DB compat mode.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Get the value of a field in the current row by column name.
methodsynopsis.desc: Will not work if ADODB_FETCH_MODE is set to ADODB_FETCH_NUM.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Get the ADOFieldObjects of all columns in an array.
PEAR DB Compat - do not use internally
return recordset as a 2-dimensional array.
return recordset as a 2-dimensional array.
methodsynopsis.desc: Helper function for ADOConnection->SelectLimit()

methodsynopsis.sdesc: return whole recordset as a 2-dimensional associative array if there are more than 2 columns.
methodsynopsis.desc: The first column is treated as the key and is not included in the array. If there is only 2 columns, it will return a 1 dimensional array of key-value pairs unless $force_array == true.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Generate a SELECT tag string from a recordset, and return the string.
methodsynopsis.desc: If the recordset has 2 cols, we treat the 1st col as the containing the text to display to the user, and 2nd col as the return value. Default strings are compared with the FIRST column.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Generate a SELECT tag string from a recordset, and return the string.
methodsynopsis.desc: If the recordset has 2 cols, we treat the 1st col as the containing the text to display to the user, and 2nd col as the return value. Default strings are compared with the SECOND column.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Use associative array to get fields array for databases that do not support associative arrays. Submitted by Paolo S. Asioli paolo.asioli#libero.it
methodsynopsis.desc: If you don't want uppercase cols, set $ADODB_FETCH_MODE = ADODB_FETCH_ASSOC before you execute your SQL statement, and access $rs->fields['col'] directly.$upper 0 = lowercase, 1 = uppercase, 2 = whatever is returned by FetchField

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Synonym for GetArray() for compatibility with ADO.

Get the metatype of the column. This is used for formatting. This is because many databases use different names for the same type, so we transform the original type to our standardised version which uses 1 character codes:
Random access to a specific row in the recordset. Some databases do not support access to previous rows in the databases (no scrolling backwards).
Move to the first row in the recordset. Many databases do NOT support this.
Move to the last row in the recordset.
Move to next record in the recordset.
PEAR DB compat, number of cols
PEAR DB compat, number of rows
Portable RecordCount. Pablo Roca
synonyms RecordCount and RowCount
synonyms RecordCount and RowCount
Constructor
Setup the array.
Setup the Array and datatype file objects
Returns the value of the property to be validated.
Loads user input data.
methodsynopsis.desc: The implementation of this function can use $values[$key] to get the user input data that are meant for the particular control.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Raises postdata changed event.
methodsynopsis.desc: The implementation of this function should raise appropriate event(s) (e.g. OnTextChanged) indicating the control data is changed.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Raises postback event.
methodsynopsis.desc: The implementation of this function should raise appropriate event(s) (e.g. OnClick, OnCommand) indicating the component is responsible for the postback event.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Unsets a session variable.
Destroys the session.
Returns the value of the named session variable
Checks if the named session variable exists.
Sets a session variable
Starts the session.
Checks if the user is of certain role.
This method is invoked by the framework when authentication fails.
This method is invoked by the framework when authorization fails.
Validates certain data.
methodsynopsis.desc: The implementation of this function should validate certain data (e.g. data entered into TTextBox control).

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Closes the DB connection.
methodsynopsis.desc: You are not required to call this method as PHP will automatically to close any DB connections when exiting a script.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Establishes a DB connection.
methodsynopsis.desc: An ADOConnection instance will be created if none. The data fetch mode is also set here.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the database name
Sets the data source name (DSN).
methodsynopsis.desc: The format of DSN is: $driver://$username:$password@hostname/$database?options[=value] Note, each part if it contains special characters you need to rawurlencode it first.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the DB driver (mysql, sqlite, etc.)
Sets the fetch mode of query data: Associative, Numeric, Both, Default (default)
Sets the DB host name/IP (and port number) in the format "host[:port]"
Sets the DB password
Sets whether the DB connection should be persistent
Sets the DB username
PHP magic function.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method will pass all method calls to ADOConnection class provided in the ADODB library.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Constructor, parses application specification.
methodsynopsis.desc: Do not use 'new' operator to create TApplication instance. Use instead to get the TApplication singleton.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Preprocessing before handling a request
methodsynopsis.desc: The method is invoked at the begin of . It removes backslashes of input data if magic_quotes_gpc is on. It also encodes the user input data (&, ", ', <, >). The encoded data are safe to be stored into database. If needed, you can decode the data by calling .Derived classes can override this method to provide customized initializations.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Constructs a URL based on the specified page name and GET parameters
Creates a component according to the given component type.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method first tries to "clone" a component if the same type has been created before. If it fails, it will seek to create the component from cache. If it still fails, it will create the component from scratch. The newly created component will be serialized in memory to expedite further component creation requests. It may also be serialized into cache if the application specification suggests so.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Creates a component from cache.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method unserializes a component from a file. The file name is the same as the component type and it is located under the "cache" directory defined in the application specification.Derived classes may override this method to provide other ways of caching component. Be sure to override to make it consistent.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Request cleanup work.
methodsynopsis.desc: Default implementation will save the user object to session if possible. The method is invoked at the end of and . Derived classes can override this method to provide customized cleanup work. Parent implementation should be invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Executes the current request using another page.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method runs through the lifecycles of the new page including Init, Load, PreRender, save viewstate, Render and Unload. It returns with the rendering result of the new page.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the default page name defined in the application specification
Returns the TApplication singleton
methodsynopsis.desc: In the first invocation of the method, it will construct a TApplication instance by either loading from a previously serialized instance from $cacheFile or creating a new one based on the specification file $specFile.In the following invocations, the parameters can be omitted and the singleton is returned.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the path corresponding to an alias.
Determines the requested page name based on the URL.
methodsynopsis.desc: Derived classes can override this method to provide other ways of URL interpretation. You may need to override as well for consistency.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Determines the required role to access the page
Returns a user-defined parameter which is defined in the application specification
Runtime initializations based on the application specification.
methodsynopsis.desc: Derived classes can override this method to provide additional initializations.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Loads a page by the specified page type.
Redirects the browser to a URL.
methodsynopsis.desc: is invoked before the redirecting.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: The main entry to serves a page request.
Saves a component to cache.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method saves the serialized component as a file. The file name is the same as the component type and it is located under the "cache" directory defined in the application specification.Derived classes may override this method to provide other ways of caching component. Be sure to override to make it consistent.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Terminates the execution of the current page and begins execution of a new page.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method simply redirects the browser to the new page.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Constructor.
methodsynopsis.desc: Sets TagName property to 'input'.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Overrides the parent implementation.
methodsynopsis.desc: No body (child) content are allowed.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This overrides the parent implementation by rendering more TButton-specific attributes.
This method is invoked when the component is clicked.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method raises 'OnClick' event to fire up the event delegates. If you override this method, be sure to call the parent implementation so that the event delegates can be invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked when the component is clicked.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method raises 'OnCommand' event to fire up the event delegates. If you override this method, be sure to call the parent implementation so that the event delegates can be invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Raises postback event.
methodsynopsis.desc: The implementation of this function should raise appropriate event(s) (e.g. OnClick, OnCommand) indicating the component is responsible for the postback event. This method is primarily used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the value indicating whether postback event trigger by this button will cause input validation.
Sets the command name associated with the OnCommand event.
Sets the parameter associated with the OnCommand event.
Sets the text caption of the button.
Constructor.
methodsynopsis.desc: Sets the tagname to 'span'.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Overrides the parent implementation.
methodsynopsis.desc: No body (child) content are allowed.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the attributes to be rendered.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method overrides the parent's implementation.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the value of the property that needs validation.
Loads user input data.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method is primarly used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked when the value of the Checked property changes between posts to the server.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method raises 'OnCheckedChanged' event to fire up the event delegates. If you override this method, be sure to call the parent implementation so that the event delegates can be invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Raises postdata changed event.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method calls method. This method is primarly used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Renders the body content of the control.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method overrides the parent's implementation.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets a value indicating whether clicking on the checkbox will post the page.
Sets a value indicating whether the checkbox is to be checked or not.
Sets the text caption of the checkbox.
Sets the text alignment of the checkbox
This method overrides the parent's implementation.
methodsynopsis.desc: The validation succeeds if the input data compares successfully. The validation always succeeds if ControlToValidate is not specified or the input data is empty.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the attributes to be rendered.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method overrides the parent's implementation.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the input component to compare with the input control being validated.
Sets the comparison operation to perform (Equal, NotEqual, GreaterThan, GreaterThanEqual, LessThan, LessThanEqual, DataTypeCheck)
Sets the constant value to compare with the value entered by the user into the input component being validated.
Sets the data type (Integer, Double, Currency, Date, String) that the values being compared are converted to before the comparison is made.
Constructor, parses specification and template files, if any.
methodsynopsis.desc: You can create a new component instance in two ways: one is to use 'new' operator, the other is to call . The latter method may expedite the instantiation if the componet has been instantiated before because a serialized version will be used to 'clone' the new instance. Do not use the latter method if in the constructor you create handles to some resources (such as DB connections.)To inheritors, be sure to call the parent constructor so that component specifications are parsed.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Attaches a handler function to an event.
Determines whether a property can be read.
Determines whether a property can be written.
Sets a property value.
methodsynopsis.desc: The value is given as a string and will be converted to the property type before assignment.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Evaluates a PHP expression.
Evaluates a list of PHP statements.
Returns the type of a property
Determines whether an event is defined.
Determines whether a property is defined.
Invokes all attached event handler functions for a particular event.
Returns a property value by name or a child control by ID.
methodsynopsis.desc: If the child control ID is the same as the property name, the property takes precedence. If none are present, the method raises an exception.This function is provided so that you can get a property of a component by ID paths, e.g.: $this->MenuBar->HyperLink->Text where Text is the property name of HyperLink which is a child control of MenuBar which is a child control of $this. Since property name takes precedence over control ID, you may need to call TControl::getControl if you want to get a child control whose ID is identical to a property name.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets value of a component property.
methodsynopsis.desc: The property must be defined in the component specification. Otherwise an exception will be raised.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Adds a child control or static text.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method will first set a unique ID to the child control if it doesn't have one. The child ID must be unique among its siblings, or an exception will be raised. If the current control is in a page hierarchy, the method will further invoke to add the child into the hierarchy as well.This method is usually used in dynamically creating controls.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Adds an object parsed from template as a child.
methodsynopsis.desc: The default implementation invokes to add the object as a child. Derived classes may override this method to check the type of the parsed object before adding it as a child or for other purposes.This method should only used by control developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns a unique ID for a new child component.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets up the binding between a property and an expression.
methodsynopsis.desc: The context of the expression is the component itself.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Performs the databinding for this control (and all its children if $recursive==true).
methodsynopsis.desc: Databinding a property includes evaluating the binded expression and setting the property with the evaluation result. It will also invoke . Note, this method should only be invoked for TControl or its desendant.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Finds a child control by a dot-connected ID path.
methodsynopsis.desc: For example, if HomePage is the parent of MenuBar which is the parent of UserName, then the UserName control can be located by the ID path "MenuBar.UserName" in HomePage.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns attributes to be rendered.
methodsynopsis.desc: The default implementation returns the Attributes property that is inserted with an 'id' attribute whose value equals to the ClientID property of the control. You can override this method to customize attributes to be rendered. Be sure to call parent's implementation first to ensure the rendering of attributes specified in parent. This method is mainly used by control developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the client ID of the component.
methodsynopsis.desc: The client ID is similar to the unique ID except underscores are used as connectors instead of colons.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the unique ID of the component.
methodsynopsis.desc: The unique ID is a colon-connected IDs of this component and all its ancestors (except the page). Unique IDs are mainly used to identify postback target.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns a viewstate value.
methodsynopsis.desc: This function is very useful in defining getter functions for control properties that must be kept in viewstate.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Initializes the properties with values defined in specification and template.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only be used by framework and control developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Parses a template string and instantiates components inside.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method parses the template string, instantiates the components delcared in the template, adds them as children of this component, and sets up container-containee relationship among them and static texts. This method should only be used by component developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Parses a template file and instantiates components inside.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method parses the template file, instantiates the components delcared in the template, adds them as children of this component, and sets up container-containee relationship among them and static texts. This method should only be used by component developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method should only be used by framework developers.
Loads viewstate into this control and its children.
methodsynopsis.desc: Current implementation is that the viewstate for a control is stored as an array. The first array element stores the viewstate of this control. The rest elements store the viewstates of the child controls, indexed by their IDs.This method should only be used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method responds to a bubbled event.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should be overriden to provide customized response at a bubbled event. Check the type of event parameter to determine what event is bubbled currently.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked when the control enters 'DataBinding' stage.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method raises 'OnDataBinding' event to fire up the event delegates. If you override this method, be sure to call the parent implementation so that the event delegates can be invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked when the control enters 'Init' stage.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method raises 'OnInit' event to fire up the event delegates. If you override this method, be sure to call the parent implementation so that the event delegates can be invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked when the control enters 'Load' stage.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method raises 'OnLoad' event to fire up the event delegates. If you override this method, be sure to call the parent implementation so that the event delegates can be invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked when the control enters 'PreRender' stage.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method raises 'OnPreRender' event to fire up the event delegates. If you override this method, be sure to call the parent implementation so that the event delegates can be invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked when the control enters 'Unload' stage.
methodsynopsis.desc: The method raises 'OnUnload' event to fire up the event delegates. If you override this method, be sure to call the parent implementation so that the event delegates can be invoked.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Invokes the parent's onBubbleEvent method.
methodsynopsis.desc: A control who wants to bubble an event must call this method in its onEvent method.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Registers a control into the existing page hierarchy.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method generates UniqueID for the registered control. It also registers the control to the page if it implements certain interfaces (IPostBackDataHandler, IPostBackEventHandler, IValidator). The control's children are also registered recursively.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Removes a child control
Removes all child controls.
Renders this control.
methodsynopsis.desc: Default implementation will render the children in order. If TagName is not empty, an enclosing tag together with Attributes will be rendered as well. This method can be overriden.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Renders the attributes.
methodsynopsis.desc: It returns a string consisting of key-value pairs based on the input array. .

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Renders the body content.
methodsynopsis.desc: Default implementation will render recursively all visible child controls and text blocks. You can override this method to render customized body content. This method is mainly used by control developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the viewstate of this control and its children.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only be used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets a component ID.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only be used by framework developers. A component cannot change its ID once it is set, or an exception will be raised.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the page that contains this component.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only be used by framework developers. A component cannot change its page once it is set, or an exception will be raised.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the tag name.
Sets a viewstate value.
methodsynopsis.desc: This function is very useful in defining setter functions for control properties that must be kept in viewstate.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Breaks the binding between a property and an expression.
Unregisters a control from the existing page hierarchy.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method unregisters a control and all its children recursively from the existing page hierarchy. If the control implements certain interfaces or extends from certain classes, it will also be unregistered from the page.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Calls of this control and its children recursively.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked when the server side validation happens.
methodsynopsis.desc: It will raise the OnServerValidate event. The method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. Note The derived classes should call parent implementation to ensure the OnServerValidate event is raised.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the name of the custom client-side script function used for validation.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Raises postdata changed event.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method calls OnSelectionChanged method. This method is primarly used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked when the component is clicked.

Constructor, initiates the page property to itself.
methodsynopsis.desc: Use TApplication::loadPage() to create a page instead of using the new operator.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Determines whether the current request is a postback.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only be used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Executes page lifecycles.
methodsynopsis.desc: If the page is requested for the first time, it consists of the following lifecycles, OnInit eventOnLoad eventOnPreRender eventsave viewstaterender pageOnUnload event If the page is requested in response to a form submission (called postback), the life cycles include OnInit eventload viewstateload post dataOnLoad eventload post data (for newly created components during Load event)OnPostDataChanged eventInput validation if the postback event handler is enabled with CausesValidation propertyPostBack eventOnPreRender eventsave viewstaterender pageOnUnload event

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the TApplication instance.
methodsynopsis.desc: The value is available since Init stage.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the currently attached form object.
Returns a javascript that can be used to trigger client-side postback event.
methodsynopsis.desc: You have to add your own javascript surrounding elements if necessary.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the session object
Indicates whether the named array has been registered before.
Indicates whether the named beginscript has been registered before.
Indicate whether the named endscript has been registered before.
Indicates whether the named hidden field has been registered before.
Indicates whether the named onsubmit statement has been registered before.
Indicates whether the current request is a postback.
methodsynopsis.desc: The value is available since Init stage.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Indicates whether the named scriptfile has been registered before.
Indicates whether the named CSS style file has been registered before.
Indicates whether all validators have successfully validated the post data.
methodsynopsis.desc: The value is available since PostBack stage.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Loads viewstate of the page and all its children from a persistence medium.
methodsynopsis.desc: By default, a hidden field is used as persistence medium. You can override this function to provide your own viewstate maintenance method. For example, you can keep the viewstate in session data or in database. If you override, you have to override as well to match the load and save processes.This method should only be used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Runs through every postdata loader to load postdata.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only be used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Checks if the user is authorized to access this page.
methodsynopsis.desc: Default implement always returns true. Derived classes may override this method to do real authorization work.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Raises PostDataChanged event for each postdata loader whose data is changed.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only be used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Register an element of a javascript array to be created on client side.
methodsynopsis.desc: The elements of multiple registration of the same array name will be merged together.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Registers a javascript block to be rendered right after the openning form element.
Register a javascript block to be rendered right before the closing form element.
Registers a hidden field to be submitted upon client postback event.
Registers a javascript statement to be executed upon client postback event.
Registers a postback event handler.
Registers a postdata loader.
methodsynopsis.desc: The control must implement IPostBackDataHandler interface.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Registers a javascript file to be loaded in client side
Registers a CSS style file to be imported with the page body
Registers a validator with the page.
methodsynopsis.desc: The validator must implement IValidator interface

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Renders the registered javascript array declarations
Renders the registered javascripts showing at the beginning of the TForm control
Renders the registered javascripts showing at the end of the TForm control
Renders the registered hidden fields
Renders the registered onsubmit statements
Renders the registered javascript files to be included
Renders the registered CSS style files to be included
Saves viewstate of the page and all its children to a persistence medium.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only be used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the application of the page.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method should only be used by framework developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Attaches the form object to the page.
methodsynopsis.desc: Only one form object can be attached.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets postback parameter
Sets postback target by its unique ID
Sets the session object of the page This method should only be used by framework developers.
Sets the user object of the page This method should only be used by framework developers.
Unregisters a postback handler from the page.
Unregister a postdata loader from the page.
Unregisters a validator from the page.
Detaches the form object from the page.
Invokes validate() method of every registered validator and update accordingly.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the name of the group that the radio button belongs to

methodsynopsis.desc: The validation succeeds if the input data is within the range. The validation always succeeds if ControlToValidate is not specified or the input data is empty.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the attributes to be rendered.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method overrides the parent's implementation.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the maximum value of the validation range.
Sets the minimum value of the validation range.
Sets the data type (Integer, Double, Currency, Date, String) that the values being compared are converted to before the comparison is made.
This method overrides the parent's implementation.
methodsynopsis.desc: The validation succeeds if the input data matches the regular expression. The validation always succeeds if ControlToValidate is not specified or the regular expression is empty, or the input data is empty.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Returns the attributes to be rendered.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the regular expression that determines the pattern used to validate a field.

methodsynopsis.desc: No body (child) content are allowed.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Handles OnBubbleEvent.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method overrides parent's implementation to handle OnItemCommand event that is bubbled from TRepeaterItem child controls. This method should only be used by control developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Parses and intantiates templates.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method is invoked when OnDataBinding event is raised. It parses and instantiates all assoicated templates for the repeater control and raises related events. This method should only used by control developers.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Raises OnItemCommand event.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method is invoked after a button control in a template raises OnCommand event. You may override this method to provide customized event handling. Be sure to call parent's implementation so that event handlers have chance to respond to the event. The TRepeaterItem control responsible for the event can be determined from the event parameter's item field. The initial sender of the OnCommand event is in source field. The command name and parameter are in name and parameter fields, respectively.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Raises OnItemCreated event.
methodsynopsis.desc: This method is invoked after a repeater item is created. You may override this method to provide customized event handling. Be sure to call parent's implementation so that event handlers have chance to respond to the event. The TRepeaterItem control responsible for the event can be determined from the event parameter's item field.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the alternative template string for the item
Sets the data source.
Sets the footer template.
methodsynopsis.desc: The template will be parsed immediately.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the header template.
methodsynopsis.desc: The template will be parsed immediately.

methodsynopsis.desc: An automatic postback to the server will occur whenever the user modifies the text in the TTextBox component and then tabs out of the component.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the display width of the text box in characters.
Sets the maximum number of characters allowed in the text box.
Sets the text caption of the checkbox.
Sets the number of rows displayed in a multiline text box.
Sets the text content of the TTextBox component.
Sets the behavior mode (SingleLine, MultiLine, or Password) of the TTextBox component.
Sets the value indicating whether the text content wraps within a multiline text box.
Checks if the user is of certain role.
methodsynopsis.desc: Default implementation will only return true if the role to be checked is empty. Derived classes should override this method if roles are used for authorization.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Authenticates a user by his/her username and password.
methodsynopsis.desc: Default implementation simply saves the username and sets authentication true. Derived classes should override this method to do real authentication work such as check the username/password against DB.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets authentication false for the user.
methodsynopsis.desc: Default implementation will destroy all session data related to the user visit. Derived classes may override this method to provide special treatment.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked by the framework when authentication fails.
methodsynopsis.desc: Default implementation simply displays an error message. Derived classes may override this method to provide customized treatment when authentication fails (e.g. transfer to login page)

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This method is invoked by the framework when authorization fails.
methodsynopsis.desc: Default implementation simply displays an error message. Derived classes may override this method to provide customized treatment when authorization fails (e.g. transfer to login page)

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the value indicating whether the user is authenticated.
Sets the username of TUser object
URL (either relative or absolute) of javascript file that contains functions for client-side validation
Overrides the parent implementation.
methodsynopsis.desc: No body (child) content are allowed.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: Sets the value whether the TValidationSummary component updates itself using client-side script.

Sets the value whether the validation summary is displayed in a message box.
Sets the value whether the validation summary is displayed inline.
Sets the value indicating whether client-side validation is enabled.
This is the major method for validation.

Sets the text content of the validator.
Sets the value indicating whether the validation succeeds
Validates the specified component.

methodsynopsis.sdesc: This overrides the parent implementation by rendering more TWebControl-specific attributes.
Sets the access key of the control.
methodsynopsis.desc: Only one-character string can be set, or an exception will be raised. Pass empty string if you want to disable access key.

Sets the border width of the control

Enables or disables a control.

Sets the CSS style of the control.

methodsynopsis.desc: Pass 0 if you want to disable tab index.
